member.name: M:OpenWeatherMap.OpenWeatherMapService.GetCurrentUVIndexAsync(System.Double,System.Double,OpenWeatherMap.Util.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets the current UV index for the specified coordinates asynchronously.
member.param: the latitude to get the weather from
the longitude to get the weather from
the request options (can change the behavior of requesting and controls caching, cancellation, unit and language options of the result)
member.returns: a task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result is the UV index; or if the city could not be found.

member.param: the city to get the information from
the country code (used to narrow down city search results)
the request options (can change the behavior of requesting and controls caching, cancellation, unit and language options of the result)
member.returns: a task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result is the weather information; or if the city could not be found.

member.returns: a task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result is the weather information; or if the city could not be found.

the country where the zip code is in (defaults to US)

member.name: M:OpenWeatherMap.OpenWeatherMapService.GetUVIndexForecastAsync(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,OpenWeatherMap.Util.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets the forecast UV index for the specified coordinates asynchronously.
member.param: the latitude to get the weather from
the longitude to get the weather from
the forecast days (max: 8)
the request options (can change the behavior of requesting and controls caching, cancellation, unit and language options of the result)
member.returns: a task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result is the UV index information; or if the city could not be found.
member.exception: thrown if the specified parameter is smaller than 1 or greater than 8.

member.summary: Gets the forecast UV index for the specified coordinates asynchronously.
member.param: the latitude to get the weather from
the longitude to get the weather from
the history start time
the history end time
the forecast days (max: 8)
the request options (can change the behavior of requesting and controls caching, cancellation, unit and language options of the result)
member.returns: a task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result is the UV index information; or if the city could not be found.
member.exception: thrown if the specified parameter is smaller than 1 or greater than 8.
thrown if the specified time is before 2017-06-22.
thrown if the time is greater than the time.

member.name: T:OpenWeatherMap.Util.CacheMode
member.summary: A set of supported caching modes.

member.name: F:OpenWeatherMap.Util.CacheMode.AllowDownload
member.summary: Allows caching and downloading.

member.name: F:OpenWeatherMap.Util.CacheMode.Download
member.summary: Does not try to get the request from the cache, this will always try to download the resource even if it is in cache.

member.name: F:OpenWeatherMap.Util.CacheMode.CacheOnly
member.summary: Throws an exception if the requested resource is not cached.

member.name: F:OpenWeatherMap.Util.CacheMode.Default
member.summary: The default .

member.summary: Hourly forecast for four days.

member.name: F:OpenWeatherMap.Util.ForecastType.ThreeHour
member.summary: Three hour forecast for five days.

member.name: F:OpenWeatherMap.Util.ForecastType.Daily
member.summary: Daily weather forecast for 16 days.

member.name: T:OpenWeatherMap.Util.UnitType
member.summary: A set of different unit types supported by OpenWeatherMap.

member.name: F:OpenWeatherMap.Util.UnitType.Default
member.summary: When specified temperature is returned in Kelvin and speeds are returned in meter per second (meter/sec).

member.name: F:OpenWeatherMap.Util.UnitType.Metric
member.summary: When specified temperature is returned in Celsius and speeds are returned in meter per second (meter/sec).

member.name: F:OpenWeatherMap.Util.UnitType.Imperial
member.summary: When specified temperature is returned in Fahrenheit and speeds are returned in miles per hour (miles/hour).
